meanings.definition: A heavy whip typically made of animal hide.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper used a sjambok to gently guide the elephant back to its enclosure.
meanings.sent2: The farmer kept a sjambok in the barn to help control unruly livestock.
meanings.sent3: During the circus show, the clown comically juggled a sjambok along with colorful balls.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the sjambok cracking through the air echoed across the open field.
meanings.sent5: The sjambok's sharp sting left a lasting impression on the misbehaving horse.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a sjambok.
meanings.sent1: The hunter had to sjambok the bushes to scare away any hidden animals.
meanings.sent2: The villagers would sjambok the drums to create a rhythmic beat during celebrations.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully pretended to sjambok the dough while preparing the bread.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to sjambok the trees with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The coach would sjambok the team into shape before the big game.
